alert.note: Alert for Fresno; Madera; Mariposa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 10 at 6:47AM PST until March 10 at 1:30PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central California and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Fresno, Madera, Mariposa and Tulare. In northern California, Tuolumne. * WHEN...Until 230 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 646 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fresno, Clovis, Yosemite South Entrance, Sanger, Reedley, Dinuba, Orosi, Orange Cove, Oakhurst, Yosemite Lakes, Bootjack, Yosemite National, East Orosi, Cutler, Mariposa, North Fork, Peckinpah, Auberry, Crane Valley Reservoir and Bass Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
